author: emilio aponte
comment: Highly recommend. Newton e-mail app is excellent with an excellent customer service. They help me, regarding some information I was looking for, with  solidarity  and efficiency and by the way just tap the icon of each e-mail account you got to open up the full features pertaining your e-mail account. Newton e-mail app is better than Maildroid an Aquamail(got the Pro or paid version of both). Newton runs smooth and fast, there's no issue with the app. Once a year they charge your credit card and I'm willingly to pay for this great e-mail app.

author: Marlon Mehr
comment: I have used Newton for a year now, and now I hate it. The poor search capabilities when you have several email accounts is pathetic! If you are looking for an old email good luck ever finding it; Newton makes you many re-search and start over per individual account (I have 17) only to rarely ever find what you need or looking for; and even when I search using a complete email address, Newton returns the most rediculous unrelated results and from junk or totally irrelevant folders and email addresses.   Now the new bug really ended it for me! I'm done typing an important email, written perfectly, and then I go out of the app to copy some text, answer a SMS msg, whatever, (30 seconds) and upon returning back to Newton my entire email draft has vanished!!! Not to be found in the original thread marked as DRAFT or within any subfolders like "Drafts".  That's it, I'm quitting this half-baked approach to an email client!  You'd think for the subscription money a Company would at least make sure basic email usage was tested and fully vetted, not Newton and it's way out of the "be patient I just released my 1.0 stage", by now the app should be growing with new features and stabilizing.  Not Newton, it's now gotten worse and gone nowhere.  I've written and written support, to no avail.   I quit, going somewhere else to find a multiplatform email solution! Spend your money on a company that puts it back into development...IMHO anyways.

author: Mathieu Chevrier
comment: Clean and efficient. Does a great job with great stability. Although 50 bucks a year is a bit steep and some functionalities could be added.

author: Chris Connell
comment: By far the best email app I have ever used, I absolutely love it. I use it along side the mac app, for read receipts and reminders. It can also remind you if you don't get a reply to an email you send. I previously tried air mail and polymail and this is far better. For such a powerful tool it is worth every penny they charge. We pay a lot for other software, why should a good email client be any different! Take the trial, you won't turn back.

author: Sumukh C
comment: This is the most coolest email apps I have ever used. It's really good but I'm uninstalling due to it's price. You guys can come down a bit on the pricing. Nevertheless a great job done by the devs!!

author: Chris Mayr
comment: Better than sliced bread. After years of using Gmail and Google Inbox I decided to try Outlook 2016...big mistake. Outlook 2016 and Outlook live suck. Newton does everything an email app should and does it well.

author: Michael Bent
comment: This is not as feature rich as an Outlook. It has calendar in phone but not on desktop. It is impossible to copy a contact/email from an email. Often times I respond to emails and need to move someone from cc to to or vis versa. Send later sometimes fails and doesn't notify you, so you always have to check if it actually sent.

author: Mark B
comment: I have Newton on multiple devices and platforms (iOS, Android, Window, Mac) - that's the reason I use and pay for the service.  Unfortunately, there's a problem with delayed syncing across all those devices, esp. if I don't use a particular device for a day or two (regardless if it's iOS, Android, Mac, Windows.)  It can take minutes to sync or even fail to fully sync unless I close and re-open the app to force another sync attempt.  Tech support says it's a known problem but the problem seems to have gotten worse over time.  Hopefully, they can resolve it soon.

author: Nancy Nooney
comment: Message receipt not working. This is the main reason I purchased it. Thinking of cancelling although just paid for another year. Interesting that my 2 stars changed to 4 stars when I submitted. Had to delete and redo review.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content:
Sorry for the hassle! 

Can you please send us an email to hello@newtonhq.com? We can surely help you out.

comment: Beautiful and easy to use. Just a heads-up, it's definitely costly given the limited feature set compared to other offerings for platform. That being said, it's my favorite client for Windows and I prefer it to Outlook for personal use.

author: Matt Parker
comment: I moved to Newton because I can use a single app with the same features and functions across all my devices (Android, Mac, Windows). I have noticed the sync bug on Windows where it won't sync after being closed for a couple of days without closing and reopening. Please fix this issue. I also noticed that you can't copy an email address. Not being able to copy an email is very annoying and a little frustrating. I have to select forward for a message. Then, copy the email address from the message forward text in the new email. That's absurd. Please fix this issue (or add the feature).  Why am I still rating as 5 stars?   Because these issues are minor to me. I can live with them. The core functions and having a single app on all devices is most important. I am ok with the price, $50 per year and I am REALLY glad you don't make me pay monthly. I do not participate in monthly app subscriptions. If it's not annual I will not subscribe.  Overall, Newton is awesome!  I'm looking forward to additonal bug fix upgrades, especially on the Windows app.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Can you please email us at hello@newtonhq.com regarding the issues you are facing? We will surely look into them.

author: Jin Han Sung
comment: Was a long fan, but IMAP support is really bad and hasn't changed for months. Really disappointed in the service.

author: Derek Thomas
comment: App works great. Would be nice if the subscription banner wasn't always there. Would actually consider subscribing if there was a lifetime purchase rather than endless billing. Devs should look at Plex's model for billing pro vs not.  Edit: bought the subscription on boxing day sale - love it. Comments on lifetime subscription still stand though

author: Dmitriy Solovyov
comment: I have to change to 1 star. I don't care about 50 dollars. I care about this app bugging me with stupid things like "access to this account has been revoked". Has never happened to any other services I used.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Can you please write to us at hello@newtonhq.com with a few more details? We'll be able to help you better there.

author: Nick Roth
comment: CloudMagic was great. Now they require $50 payment to use. Are you kidding? Show me a successful app that charges that much to use services that are free. Uninstalled and using TypeApp now.

author: Ana Bedouines
comment: This is the most effective email and calendar interface I've ever used. The blue tick feature that tells you when your email is read is great . Wish I could afford this app but the cost is too high for me.

author: Jibreel Powell
comment: By far the best email app I have used on Android. I haven't feel in control of my emails for months, but Newton has definitely changed that

author: Mohamad Hussein
comment: Very nice application. Wish there is an email wigget with emails seen rather than a counter. Overall excellent!

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback! All the suggested features are present on our wish list. We will take them up as soon as possible and keep you informed on the developments.

comment: Awesome email client that has integration with Todoist and Evernote.  If you want to be super productive, I highly recommend you invest in your success, today.

author: JOE NASR
comment: add folders and create filters? Or you stopped updating it?

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: On mobile, you'll be able to create a folder while moving an email. Just type in the name of the folder you are trying to create and you should see an option to create one. The ability to create filters is in our plans but no ETA as of now.

author: Trevor Elliott
comment: Is a paid app monthly, useless.

author: Raghu Ram Mullapudi
comment: Best email client i had used so far.

author: JIGNESH KATARIA
comment: Fantabulous app, price should be lower for yearly subscription

author: Carlos Duran
comment: Best email work hands down!

author: Mohamed El-Badawy
comment: Clean. Light. Simple. Easy.

author: David Butler
comment: After Outlook basically stopped working on my Pixel (strange white screens for ages) I looked around for a better alternative.  The Guardian in the UK gave it a good review, tried it. Really fast, simple and clean.  The 20% discount offer tipped me into purchase mode, but to be fair, I probably would have paid full price. It just seems to work.

author: Mayank Gulia
comment: I have tried multiple email clients, both on iOS and Android. Nothing holds a candle to CloudMagic in terms of speed, effectiveness and quality of UI. Not even the stock email clients. Very simple. Very intuitive. Extremely fast.   But it offers no customization. You can't even chose your sync settings frequency.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Newton works based on push technology. So, if there is a new email in the server, it tells the app. The app doesn't request the server for new mails at regular intervals. Hence, there is no sync interval provided. This is an optimal way of functioning which guarantees low battery usage. Furthermore, new emails are delivered to you instantly.

author: iker Laz
comment: Easily the best email app out there HOWEVER there's two major flaws. First why can't we pay monthly for the service? You're forcing us to go with a one year payment in advance! And secondly, price is absurd. I was convinced that it's worth the price but no way I'll pay 50$ for an email app one shot. Congratulations, you played yourself.

This is by far the simplest and most efficient way of combining all your email accounts for push notifications, with all the features you would otherwise pay for elsewhere i.e. read receipt / tracking, profile lookup. Inky is / was more expensive, Boomerang is still more expensive than this, and now they have a windows application.   Seriously, quit the beef over the cost, if you want a simple ubiquitous experience pay the cash. If not, move along.   Some things I would ask for are 1) being able customise and set default font and size etc... 2) more integrations such as Dropbox. 3) the ability to insert the signature (or remove it) from within the compose window. 4) A cloud web app would also be great.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Thanks a lot for the feedback, Jan :)

comment: I used to love this app when it was still CloudMagic. Once they switched it to a paid model, I kept using it even with the annoying yellow advertisement asking me to buy. I stopped using it completely once they removed the free option. I recently came back to see if it was worth the cost, as it's the only mail app I've found that actually supports archiving mail from multiple accounts at once. However two things kept me from buying it. One, it's way too expensive and there is no option for monthly payments. Secondly, it doesn't even properly work like it used to. I will randomly not get email and things will randomly not send. So CloudMagic, this time it's goodbye for good.

author: Mahe
comment: Loved the app. Hated that I was abruptly pushed out.   But finally bit the bullet and got a subscription. I hope the money is worth it.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Sorry for the hassle! Could you please send us an email regarding this issue at hello@cloudmagic.com?

author: Joey Hill
comment: I loved Cloud Magic and was very fast to lose it, and I was thrilled to find this, its worthy successor. Newton includes not only  the best, perhaps all of the features of its predecessor but also a clean and attractive desktop app. The price is comparable to competitors' prices, but Newton is by my estimation the best!

author: Stoyan Stoitsev
comment: Finally an app that has the courage to go into a subscription model. That is the only sustainable way to deliver a good product and be honest with your customers. Even more valid when you are targeting business users. Take my money! Main problem for me however is the suboptimal handling of threaded e-mails which is a very common use case in enterprise environment. This makes the app rather useless for business. Removing two stars for the lack of development on that part and will leave my subscription expire. Will re-evaluate once this feature gets more attention.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Can you please elaborate on your concern regarding handling of email threads and write to us at hello@newtonhq.com? We'll surely look into it.

author: Jason Blackwood
comment: Drains the battery if you have alot of messages and leave sync on - won't drain if you keep it off, but then what's the point? It's also way too expensive.

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: Can you please write to us at hello@newtonhq.com? We'll be able to assist you better there.

author: Derek Owen
comment: Absolutely brilliant best of all no more spam. Knocks Gmail into a cocked hat I can thoroughly recommend it to all.

author: Partha Pratim Paul
comment: Very good email app till date used & support team was really helpful . Am really satisfied to use Newton though it paid app that's not big issue , it have many good option which are really unique & it's not present in all other app . It had app in all platform like Mac/Windows/iOS for iPhone & iPad , Also in Android for all Android mobile .. I personally use this app on all platform for my office email & other ..  Really good app 👍keep it up Newton team ...

By far the cleanest, simplest email client for Android. Yes, paying $4 a month sucks since we've all gotten used to free email clients. However, if you appreciate good design, high value, and simple yet powerful functionality, it's well worth the price of a Starbucks coffee a month. At least try it!

author: Loveesh Arora
comment: I'm unable to set my account picture (by going to Settings -> My Newton Account), is it a bug?

reply.author: CloudMagic, Inc.
reply.content: There is no way to upload an image from your device to set as Newton profile picture. The profile picture is fetched directly from your Google account. If you have a Google account added to Newton, you will be able to see it.

comment: Simple, beautiful, and works great, it's easily the best email app out there!

author: Vivek Mohandas
comment: A great app for emails. Loved it from day one. Cool and useful features. Simple to use. And great interface and user experience. Kudos to the product design and interface team
